task-wr.title: Using a Controller Configuration Input File
task-wr.shortdesc: For automated installation, you can create a configuration file to use with the controller configuration script.

context.p: US62804 new topicThe controller configuration script accepts a path to a configuration file as an optional parameter:
where filename is the path and name of the file.

The configuration file contains all the settings required by the script, expressed using INI format. You can create one manually, or you can use the configuration file generator utility provided with the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Guest Software Development Kit. For more about the format, see . US63902 and US63694 addFor information about the configuration file generator utility, see HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Software Development Kit: wrs-configutilities—Configuration Utilities.

You can validate a configuration file before applying it, using the config_validator utility provided with the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Guest Software Development Kit. The same validation is also performed automatically when the configuration controller script is executed.
For information about the configuration file validator utility, see HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Software Development Kit: wrs-configutilities—Configuration Utilities.
